traits.self_identification_and_call: Presents himself as a called apostle of Jesus Christ, commissioned by God to proclaim the gospel.
traits.relationship_to_jesus: Knows Jesus as the exalted, risen Lord and treats the crucifixion and resurrection as central saving events.
traits.mission_and_audience: Understands his primary vocation as apostle to the Gentiles while also engaging Jews in cities across the eastern Mediterranean.
traits.theological_emphases: Develops themes of justification, participation in Christ, the work of the Spirit, and the inclusion of Gentiles apart from the works of the Mosaic law.
traits.conflicts_and_authority: Frequently defends his apostolic authority against rivals and negotiates tensions with Jerusalem leaders and local communities.
traits.suffering_and_ministry_style: Describes his ministry as marked by weakness, hardship, and persecution interpreted as participation in Christ's sufferings.
traits.co_workers_and_networks: Names a wide network of co-workers, patrons, and house-church leaders across many assemblies.

traits.pre_christian_persecutor: Introduced as Saul, a zealous persecutor of the Jesus movement who approves the stoning of Stephen.
traits.conversion_and_call: Experiences a dramatic encounter with the risen Jesus on the road to Damascus that reorients him from persecutor to chosen instrument.
traits.commission_and_relationship_to_church: Is commissioned to carry the name of Jesus before Gentiles, kings, and Israelites while remaining connected to Jerusalem and Antioch leaders.
traits.missionary_journeys: Undertakes multiple missionary journeys across Asia Minor and Greece, typically beginning in synagogues before turning to Gentile audiences.
traits.signs_speeches_and_theology: Performs healings and exorcisms and delivers speeches that summarize the gospel in ways suited to Jewish and Gentile audiences.
traits.suffering_trials_and_status: Endures imprisonments, beatings, plots, and shipwrecks yet also benefits from Roman citizenship and invokes legal rights.
traits.journey_to_rome_and_fate: Appeals to Caesar and is transported to Rome, where he preaches the kingdom of God; his ultimate fate is left unstated.
